pullrequest.title: Handle authentication error connecting to lyse

content.raw: The blacs host has zprocess [139dcc6](https://bitbucket.org/cbillington/zprocess/commits/139dcc6a98451b335eae46554efc13b28cdbd59e) \(one commit downstream from 2.12.5\). In light of our discussion on [labscript\_utils PR 77](#!/labscript_suite/labscript_utils/pull-requests/77), my observation \(2\) is as intended, i.e. `allow_insecure` has no effect here, and encryption is in effect. Observations \(1\) and \(3\) are expected behaviour and unrelated to the scenario you had in mind here. I tested the scenario you described and see the correct tooltip. Moreover, when I restart lyse the analysis submission loop dutifully sends the shot to the now encrypted lyse session.
content.html: The blacs host has zprocess 139dcc6 (one commit downstream from 2.12.5). In light of our discussion on labscript_utils PR 77, my observation (2) is as intended, i.e. allow_insecure has no effect here, and encryption is in effect. Observations (1) and (3) are expected behaviour and unrelated to the scenario you had in mind here. I tested the scenario you described and see the correct tooltip. Moreover, when I restart lyse the analysis submission loop dutifully sends the shot to the now encrypted lyse session.
